title: Eldigan The Lionheart
opening: King Chagall has fled Agusty's fall and moved his royal court to Madino Castle in the north. Honoring his promise to Eldigan, Sigurd allows Chagall his freedom and does not interfere.

Sigurd adopts Agusty as his headquarters, and while his troops there recuperate, he persists in negotiating Agustria's return to governance by its own king. Despite his determination to restore Chagall's rule, his orders from Belhalla never change: to remain in Agusty and to govern its citizens.

Scarcely six months have passed, and yet Grannvale's ruling administrators have already grown arrogant and have taken to abusing their power over Agustria for their own gain. Day by day, the Agustrian people grow ever wearier of Grannvale's actions. Before long, as he feared, Sigurd finds himself yet again caught in a new conflict.
Reports abound of Chagall raising his army anew at Madino Castle, vying to reclaim his lost capital from Sigurd.

Further north beyond Madino, the reviled pirates of Orgahil prepare themselves to sweep in and profit from the land's chaos. Belhalla's orders demand that Sigurd must maintain control of Agusty above all else. Sigurd's heart lies heavy in the face of the impending crisis. Southwest of Madino, Eldigan's forces hold the defenses of Fort Silvail.
The looming battle for Agustria... A trial between friendship and loyalties. Before Sigurd looms a final battle in Agustria's north: a showdown fated to shape the course of Jugdral's history.

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: Is the army ready to move in? Those fools couldn't possibly see this coming. Right, as arranged. Move out! This is our final chance to return Agusty to our control. Just look at them... Lingering in my kingdom, oh-so-carefree. ...I grow weary of them. They will pay dearly for this! Jacoban! Where's that lousy sellsword gotten to this time?!

intro.speaker: Jacoban
intro.line: Need me, do you?

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: I've seen just how good a fighter you are. You're in charge of the castle defenses.

intro.speaker: Jacoban
intro.line: Yeah, I know... Might be a boring job, but you're payin' awfully well for it. Let's see 'em learn to fear my bolt sword.

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: That's what I like to hear. Don't fail me.

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: Now, Eldigan's still at Silvail, is he? Hm... How will he take this? I wonder…

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Milord, we have a problem! The Madino army appears to be preparing for battle!

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: What?! What is His Majesty thinking, doing something so rash? Blast... To think, we were so close to returning Agusty to him! Gah... I couldn't possibly fight Sigurd. What in the world can I do now…

intro.speaker: Duval
intro.line: Oi, cap'n! Looks like the mainland down south's gettin' ready for 'nother war. This is gettin' interestin'... This is our chance, I reckon, with nuthin' stoppin' us from fleecin' the villages. Both them armies'll be at each other's throats, so there'll be nobody interested in gettin' between us an' th' villages.

intro.speaker: Brigid
intro.line: Shut it, Duvall! I won't allow any petty thefts under my watch. I refuse to let us sink so low. Don't forget, we're heroic thieves. That's what the name of Orgahil now means to the world!

intro.speaker: Duval
intro.line: Bah! What self-respectin' pirate just lets the loot sit there an' does nothing?! The cap'n's gone soft!

intro.speaker: Pizare
intro.line: Now, now. Calm down, Duvall, me mate. I've got me a li'l idea. That wench struts aroun' like the boss, but she ain't really the ol' cap'n's sprog. The cap'n jus' found 'er lost when she as a tiny thing an' raised 'er as 'is own. She still took over when 'e died, but little she knows she ain't really his brat. She ain't the real boss, so there's nuffin' t'worry 'bout. Now, let's go 'elp ourselves to sum treasure!

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: Dire news, sire! King Chagall's army has struck, and they have the castle surrounded!

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: What?! That fool... We were so close to finally withdrawing from Agustria. There's no sense in attacking us now! Where in blazes is Eldigan...

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: That isn't all, sire. It appears that pirates from Orgahil are attacking amidst the confusion.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Is that so... I suppose we've no choice, then. Ready everyone for battle.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: My love... You're about to fight again, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: I'm afraid so. I'm sorry, Deirdre, but you mustn't come with me this time. Seliph is but a newborn, and he needs you.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: Yes, dear...

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: You needn't look so anxious, Deirdre. I'll be back before long. I promise. Shannan, I've a favor to ask of you. Would you look after Deirdre and Seliph, please?

intro.speaker: Shannan
intro.line: Of course! Don't worry about a thing.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: Ha! As spirited as ever, Shannan. At the very least, Deirdre, he ought to keep you in good cheer. Don't worry about a thing, Deirdre. I'll be back for you. I promise.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: Milord…

battle.speaker: Dew
battle.line: Oh, whoa! This is that Tower of Bragi place, isn't it? Hee hee! Got a good thiefy feeling about this one! Let's see what it's got…

battle.speaker: Dew
battle.line: Mmm? Nope, nothin' over here. Over there, maybe? ...Aww, man! What a borin' little dump.

battle.speaker: Dew
battle.line: Heh, maybe if I pretend I can't hear 'em...
How dare you... defile this sacred ground... ...BEGONE!

battle.speaker: Dew
battle.line: Kyaaa! S-sorry! Please don't hurt me!

battle.speaker: Dew
battle.line: Hah... hah... What just happened?! ...Hang on. A sword? What's it doin' sitting around a place like this? Eh, who cares? Guess I'm gettin' something outta this after all!

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Good. We've subdued the pirate castle. Oifey, would you please gather our troops here? Now that this is all over, I'd like to ensure that everyone's alright.

end.speaker: Langobalt
end.line: Is the army ready? Good. All units, move in! Apprehend the traitor Sigurd and his cohorts! Seize these vile allies of Byron, accomplices to his murder of Kurth and his bid to take over the kingdom! It is the will of His Majesty! No mercy for enemies of the state!

end.speaker: Reptor
end.line: Kehehe... Oh, Langobalt. Such audacity! To think, he personally put an end to that miserable prince and nearly killed Byron for putting up a fight... I've never seen such a bold ploy! And with Arvis using His Majesty's trust, it all worked flawlessly! Convincing the king of anything is hardly a challenge, but to succeed with a tale of this scale takes quite the storyteller... And here we are, the entirety of House Chalphy framed for the crime! Heh heh... Our victory is all but assured. The throne of Grannvale shall be mine, one way or another. I'll leave no pest who dares interfere with me alive…

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: What in blazes is this?! I'm a traitor now, and a Grannvale legion now waits at our doorstep to arrest me?!

end.speaker: Oifey
end.line: Sire, and to think, the war here was over at long last, and you were about to go and search for Deirdre.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Gah... How could His Majesty have fallen for Reptor's lies? How could he possibly believe that my father, of all people, would kill Prince Kurth?! Aah... If only Father Claud had gotten back to the capital before they struck... Why?! Why is this happening?! I fought a pointless war, I let Eldigan die, and now this! What have I been fighting for all along?!

end.speaker: Annand
end.line: Lord Sigurd, I presume? I am Annand, a knight in the service of Silesse. Queen Rahna bade my corps and I to come and retrieve you. We invite you and your subordinates to retreat with us to Silesse, until your good name has been cleared in Grannvale.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: ...Queen Rahna of Silesse, you say? Why is Silesse willing to give aid to an alleged traitor like me?

end.speaker: Annand
end.line: Please, sir. Time is of the essence. The Grannvale assault is sure to begin at any moment now. My pegasus knights will escort you across the sea to safety in Silesse.

visit.speaker: Politician
visit.line: Oh? Here to help, are ya? Huzzah! The village is saved! We can't thank ya enough, but mayhap this magic staff'll help ya out. They call it a Restore staff. If yer allies've been put t'sleep or silenced, one cast of this staff'll get 'em back on their feet. This oughta be a big help for ya.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Ah... the Cross Knights. Lord Eldigan's elite knightly battalion. Their might is legendary, and none in Jugdral can even compare to them. Actually... My boyfriend is a Cross Knight! Hee hee... amazing, isn't it? Don't be shy. Drink up! Well, how 'bout that? Feel the might swellin' in yer muscles! Oughta make yer work out there so much easier.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Sniff... I can't believe it. My boyfriend died in this blasted war. Damn the Grannvale army... No, no... Damn King Chagall! This is all his fault!

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Oho! Glad to see ya've come. I got this 'ere sword for ya in 'preciation. They call it the wingslayer. It's enchanted to be lethal to sky-riders. If it flies, this sword'll bring it down. 'Course, if ya can't use it, sell it!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: No matter how much I think about it, I just don't get why the Orgahil pirates have so suddenly turned on us like this. We could've sworn that boss of theirs was a good lass... Brigid or something, was it?

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Oh, it's so nice to see visitors! How 'bout a little somethin' for yer troubles? Here, take a draught of our secret medicine.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: Hey, be careful out there! Rumor has it that King Chagall's got the infamous Thracian wyvern riders on his payroll. Don't think there's been a war lately where someone or other didn't hire 'em. They're like a pack of hyenas descendin' on fresh prey: brutal and indiscriminate. Nothin' survives in their wake…

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: We're so glad to see you! Here, have a quick sip of our local special brew. For generations, it's made us all hardier!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Ugh. I can't stand people like you who've nothin' better to do than start more wars! Why are you even here? We've absolutely nothin' to do with Agustria or Grannvale! Look. If you've really gotta fight, take it somewhere else, you thoughtless sod.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, dear... But I think I owe you an apology.

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Eh? What's happened, Ethlyn? By the look of it, it must be grave indeed...

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Here. Take this.

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: A spear? ...What?! I-isn't this Gáe Bolg?! Why do you-

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Your lord father entrusted it to me, Quan. He thought it prudent for you to have it at hand, in case our battles grew too fierce.

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Even just holding it, I've seldom felt so strong! Why did you wait till now, though?

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: With the spear, your lord father also passed onto me its tale... I'm so sorry...

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: ...Aye. Gáe Bolg bears the baggage of a truly sad legend. But that is all it is: a legend.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: But-

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Ethlyn, trust me. Triumph is within our grasp this day. I'll not fall victim to an old myth. I'll not let it stop me from returning home. Our dear little Altena still awaits us, and I'll not allow some fairy tale to disappoint her.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Yes... Quan, no matter what happens... We'll never lose each other... Right?

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Ah, you're concerned about Deirdre, aren't you... There's nothing to worry about. It won't be long until we find her.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Yes... I want to believe she'll be okay, too. I wish I could believe it. But...

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Ethlyn? Come now! Dry your tears. Do you truly feel so bad about this?

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: I... Yes... Knowing th-that Sigurd and Deirdre may never meet again... Th-they love each other so... so much... Why, Quan... Why did this happen to them?!

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Ethlyn…

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Are you holding up okay, Brigid?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Huh? Who're you? Wait... How do you know my name?!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: The villagers told me of a woman who leads the pirates of Orgahil, and of her devotion to aiding the poor and weak. That would be you, correct?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: You must be that Grannvale man... Sigurd, right? Guess this is it. Come on. Just get it over with.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Ahahaha! Oh no, you're mistaken! I'm certain not here to kill you. I just want to talk to you, Brigid. I'd like you to ally with us. We'd love to add your strength to our own, to help us better fight the pirates. What say you?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Wait. You really want me, of all people?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Certainly! You'd be a tremendous asset.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: You're a strange little man, Sigurd…

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: ...Lady Aideen?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Huh? Who're you? You don't look familiar.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Oh, sorry! You're not her. My mistake. But then, that must make you...

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: What's this you're mumbling about? Speak up, you weird little man!

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Er... May I ask your name?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: I'm Brigid.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Brigid... You're gorgeous...

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Excuse me?! You've gotta be joking!

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: I must be dreaming... There's another one... And she's even more beautiful!

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Ugh... That's it!

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, but are you not... Yes! It is you! My sister! Brigid! I am Aideen, your sister! Surely you recall me?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: What? How do you know my name? Hang on... You look just like me! Aideen, huh... It sounds kinda familiar... But where from?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Brigid, listen well. I am your twin sister! We lost you to pirates years ago, when you were just five years old. I've searched for you for years. I never lost hope that we would meet again.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: This is all so sudden... No. Weird feelings like this aren't enough! I need proof!

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Proof, you say? Here. Draw this bow.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Huh? Okay, that's a nice bow and all, but what's it gotta do with anything? Guess I'll humor you. So I draw it and- ...Whoa! W-what's going on?! The hell is this...? I... What's this weird feeling boiling within me... Are these memories? Ah... my heart is on fire... Aideen? Yes... I remember now! You're Aideen... my sister.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Oh, thank the gods! You remember! That bow is your birthright, Brigid. It is Yewfelle, the sacred bow of Jungby. Legends tell that the exalted weapons of this land, such as this one, can only be wielded by a single heir per generation. For House Jungby and Yewfelle, that rightful heir is you, Brigid. I trust this proof will suffice?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Oh, Aideen... Come here... Let me get a good look at you... How's our father doing? And our brother... Andorey, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: I've so much to tell you, too... Brigid... My sister.

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Lord Sigurd! I apologize for the wait.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Father Claud, you're safe! We heard about how you ended up amidst all those pirates. Everyone was so worried.

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: I'm glad Tailtiu was close at hand. We may not have survived, if not for her magic. More importantly, Lord Sigurd, my prayers to Saint Bragi were answered.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: You have the truth of all this, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: That I do. As I thought, Duke Reptor is behind all of this. On his orders, it was Duke Langobalt who killed Prince Kurth. The two then successfully framed your father, Lord Byron, for the crime.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Just as I thought...

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: The pair's treachery runs deeper still. The murder of Isaach's King Mananan was also the handiwork of Duke Reptor. He feared a peaceful end to the war would end the sole excuse for the conquest of Isaach, so he secretly had the king killed.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Is that so... Reptor's grubby hands are all over this mess...

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Not quite. In the shade of his avarice, there's something else at work... Something unsettling and terrifying. Not even Lord Bragi could scry this evil presence, obscured by its power as it is.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: An evil presence? Could it be that dark priesthood... Wait! What of my father, Claud?

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Lord Byron yet lives, but is injured and weak. I fear he is not long for this world...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Father... This can't be happening...

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: I'll hasten back to the capital. His Majesty needs to hear the truth. Lord Sigurd, for the time being, stay here and restrain yourself from rash action.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Understood. I can't thank you enough, Father Claud. I beg of you, do everything you can. Save my father and his good name.

battle-talk.speaker: Claud
battle-talk.line: Our fates lie with the mercy of the gods...

boss-talk.speaker: Lachesis
boss-talk.line: Brother, stop! It's me, Lachesis! This pointlessness has gone on long enough! Your actions are utterly baffling! Would you really betray Sigurd, your friend? Is this what you call a knight's pride?! Please, brother! Believe in Sigurd. Give him even the tiniest amount more time to finish his job. We don't need to fight.

boss-talk.speaker: Eldigan
boss-talk.line: Lachesis... Look, don't cry. Fighting is my only choice. Please don't make this harder than it already is. His Majesty's death will spell the death of Agustria, too, and I cannot allow that.

boss-talk.speaker: Lachesis
boss-talk.line: That isn't true! Everything hinges on Chagall laying down his arms. Sigurd never had any interest in fighting, and has even less interest in continuing if you stop. Brother... Please. You lead the Cross Knights! Chagall simply cannot ignore your counsel!

boss-talk.speaker: Eldigan
boss-talk.line: ...You're right, Lachesis. I'll try and persuade His Majesty, one more time. If I must risk my life, I'd rather risk it to stop this blasted war than to fight my friend. Any knight would do the same. Lachesis... here. This sword is for you.

boss-talk.speaker: Lachesis
boss-talk.line: Isn't this an earth sword?! ...Brother, you can't be-

boss-talk.speaker: Eldigan
boss-talk.line: This is a last memento, in case I... I'm sorry, Lachesis. You must survive!

boss-talk.speaker: Eldigan
boss-talk.line: Your Majesty, please order a retreat! There's no use in continuing this fight. Agusty shall be returned to Your Majesty someday, but it must happen peacefully.

boss-talk.speaker: Chagall
boss-talk.line: Eldigan! How dare you abandon the battle to spout such nonsense! You couldn't hide your true colors forever, traitor! Men! Seize this... this worm! Off with his head! Humiliate him! Parade his shame before the world!

boss-talk.speaker: Eldigan
boss-talk.line: I... this was all in vain... This spells Agustria's doom-

boss-talk.speaker: Chagall
boss-talk.line: Tch, enough! Accept your death quietly, traitor! Finish him! Do it, right here, right NOW!

boss.speaker: Papillon
boss.line: Heh... Allow me to teach you the terror of the Thracian wyvern riders!

boss.speaker: Pizare
boss.line: Them Grannvale guys, huh? Hold still an' let me teach ya t'fear the pirates o' Orgahil!

boss.speaker: Pizare
boss.line: D-damn... Th-the pirates o' Orgahil... Never lose... do we?

boss.speaker: Duvall
boss.line: Ugh, me men're jus' as useless as always! Damn all y'all!

boss.speaker: Duvall
boss.line: Geh! Yer still clingin' t'life, wench?! Damn yer stubbornness!

boss.speaker: Brigid
boss.line: Duvall! You'll pay through the nose for your treachery!
